My husband and I had a wonderful quick getaway to McPherson! It was our first time visiting, and we already want to go back. McPherson still has a pretty lively Main Street/downtown area. All within walking distance, we went to two antique stores (The Ark definitely being the better one on Main Street), two gaming stores (that any other fellow nerds would love), and several restaurants that were all wonderful (Neighbors Cafe for breakfast, Main Street Deli for lunch, Easy for a drink, and Ristorante Italiano de Famiglia for dinner). And the apartment itself was super adorable - we loved the antique feel but still with any modern amenities you need (tv, wifi, etc.) My favorite part was getting to spend a lovely morning on the rooftop porch drinking coffee, watching the sunrise, and quizzing each other on â€˜90s trivia from one of the provided games the host has in a bin in the living room. I canâ€™t recommend this place enough!
A quick heads-up, though, for anyone visiting in the summertime - there is a/c, but the old building has a hard time keeping up when itâ€™s 100 degrees outside. The host was very nice and quick to respond when we asked to turn the temperature down a bit, but unfortunately the a/c running nonstop could not cool below 76 during the heat of the day. Totally understandable for the age of the building and of no fault to the owner, so this is not intended to be a bad review, but I just want others to be aware of this in case theyâ€™re like me and keep their house at 68 and have a hard time sleeping if itâ€™s too warm!
